Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates by stating that J.T. Brown was fired for raising his fist during the national anthem, when in reality the Tampa Bay Lightning released a statement supporting him.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it is based on a fabricated quote from a disreputable website.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that J.T. Brown was fired for his protest, without providing sufficient evidence or factual basis.
Exist alternative explanation: There is an alternative explanation to the claim, which is that J.T. Brown was not fired but instead received support from the Tampa Bay Lightning.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that J.T. Brown was not fired, as confirmed by the statement released by the Tampa Bay Lightning.
Falters at times: The claim falters at times by presenting false information, such as attributing a quote to the wrong person (Burt Lancaster instead of Jeff Vinik).
Understate: There is no evidence of any bias of understating in the claim.
